episodeTitle: A Descendant of the Beast! Little Oars Jr. - Full Speed Ahead!
episodeTitleJapanese: 魔人の子孫！リトルオーズJr.驀進！
episodeTitleRomanized: Majin no Shison! Ritoru Ōzu Junia Bakushin!
description: Little Oars Jr. charges through Marineford Bay toward the execution platform to rescue Ace. Despite fierce resistance from the Giant Squad and devastating attacks from the Shichibukai including Kuma's Ursus Shock and Doflamingo severing his leg, Oars continues his desperate push forward, driven by memories of Ace's kindness.

events.title: Little Oars Jr. Charges Through Marineford Bay
events.description: Little Oars Jr. begins his desperate charge toward the execution platform to save Ace, throwing a Marine battleship to clear a path through the bay for the Whitebeard Pirates. The Giant Squad attempts to stop him but he defeats them with relative ease.
events.significance: Opens a critical pathway through Marineford Bay for the Whitebeard Pirates to advance, demonstrating the power of Little Oars Jr. and his deep loyalty to Ace.

quotes.text: I just want to save Ace!
quotes.speaker: Little Oars Jr.
quotes.context: Responding to Whitebeard's warning not to rush to his death

events.title: Giant Squad Attempts to Stop Oars Jr.
events.description: The Marine Giant Squad, including Vice Admiral Lacroix, leaves their defensive positions to attack Little Oars Jr. However, he overpowers them and throws a Marine battleship at them, dispatching them one by one with relative ease.
events.significance: Demonstrates Little Oars Jr.'s overwhelming strength against even elite Marine forces, highlighting the desperate situation for the Marines.

events.title: Boa Hancock Enters the Battle
events.description: Boa Hancock finally steps into the battle, attacking both pirates and marines indiscriminately. She declares that all men, both Marine and pirate alike, are her enemies with Luffy being the lone exception.
events.significance: Reveals Hancock's true allegiance during the war and her willingness to attack both sides, demonstrating her independence from Marine control.

events.title: Bartholomew Kuma's Ursus Shock Devastating Attack
events.description: Bartholomew Kuma unleashes a massive Ursus Shock attack, creating an enormous paw-shaped explosion that critically damages Little Oars Jr., shatters his blade, destroys the thick ice sheet he was standing on, and causes massive structural damage to Marineford Bay.
events.significance: First major blow that stops Little Oars Jr.'s advance, demonstrating the overwhelming power of the Shichibukai and Kuma's Devil Fruit abilities at their full potential.

events.title: Flashback: Ace Crafts a Giant Kasa for Oars Jr.
events.description: As Little Oars Jr. falls to his knees from Kuma's attack, he remembers when Ace crafted a giant kasa (hat) for him to provide shelter from the sun, rain, and snow. Ace learned to make the kasa in Wano Country, though it took him three tries as he burned the first two due to his Mera Mera no Mi powers.
events.significance: Establishes the deep friendship between Ace and Little Oars Jr., explaining Oars' motivation for risking his life. This emotional moment resonates throughout the arc and demonstrates Ace's kindness toward others.

events.title: Oars Jr. Decides to Continue Despite Mortal Wounds
events.description: Surprising all the Marines, Little Oars Jr. gets back up after Kuma's devastating Ursus Shock attack, driven by his determination to save Ace and repay the kindness shown to him. He decides to take down at least one of the Shichibukai before falling.
events.significance: Demonstrates the unbreakable bonds of friendship in One Piece and the lengths characters will go to protect those they care about, even at the cost of their own lives.

events.title: Doflamingo Severs Little Oars Jr.'s Right Leg
events.description: As Little Oars Jr. attempts to attack one of the Shichibukai, Donquixote Doflamingo uses his Ito Ito no Mi (String-String Fruit) powers to sever Oars Jr.'s right leg with his invisible strings. This is the first clear demonstration of Doflamingo's cutting ability.
events.significance: Critically wounds Little Oars Jr. and demonstrates Doflamingo's ruthless nature and mysterious Devil Fruit powers. This moment shows the true danger of the Shichibukai.

events.title: Gecko Moria Impales Oars Jr. with Tsuno-Tokage
events.description: Furious at Doflamingo for damaging what he sees as his future zombie, Gecko Moria decides to finish off Little Oars Jr. properly by impaling him with his Tsuno-Tokage (Shadow Horn Spears) technique, finally bringing down the giant as he reaches for the execution platform.
events.significance: Deals the final blow to Little Oars Jr., ending his heroic charge. This moment marks the end of one of Marineford's most emotional storylines and demonstrates the cruelty of the Shichibukai.

quotes.text: I just want to save Ace!
quotes.speaker: Little Oars Jr.

themes.description: The episode centers on Little Oars Jr.'s unwavering loyalty to Ace, willing to sacrifice everything to save his friend who showed him kindness.
themes.symbolism: The giant kasa (hat) that Ace made for Oars Jr. symbolizes their friendship and the bonds that drive characters to risk their lives for one another.
culturalReferences: The kasa is a traditional Japanese conical hat, and Ace learning to make it in Wano Country connects to Japanese cultural elements

themes.description: Little Oars Jr. willingly faces impossible odds and accepts mortal wounds in his attempt to save Ace, embodying the theme of self-sacrifice for those we care about.
themes.symbolism: Oars continuing to fight despite devastating injuries symbolizes the strength of conviction and the willingness to sacrifice oneself for others.

themes.description: The brutal attacks from the Shichibukai and the fall of Little Oars Jr. highlight the devastating human cost of the war at Marineford.
themes.symbolism: The severing of Oars Jr.'s leg and his ultimate fall represent the physical and emotional toll of the conflict.

characterSpotlights.development: We witness Little Oars Jr.'s heroic charge and ultimate fall, learning about his deep friendship with Ace through emotional flashbacks. His determination to save Ace despite impossible odds makes him a sympathetic and tragic figure.
keyActions: Charges through Marineford Bay toward Ace
Survives Kuma's Ursus Shock and stands back up
Remembers Ace's kindness with the kasa
Gets his leg severed by Doflamingo
Falls after being impaled by Moria's Tsuno-Tokage
quotes: I just want to save Ace!

characterSpotlights.development: Through flashbacks, we see Ace's kindness toward Little Oars Jr., crafting a giant kasa to protect him from the elements. This reinforces why so many are willing to risk everything to save him.
keyActions: Crafted a giant kasa for Little Oars Jr. in the past
Watches helplessly from the execution platform

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates his ruthless nature and mysterious Devil Fruit powers by severing Oars Jr.'s leg, showing no mercy even to a critically wounded opponent.
keyActions: Severs Little Oars Jr.'s right leg with his string powers

characterSpotlights.development: Displays the full devastating power of his Nikyu Nikyu no Mi with the Ursus Shock attack, serving as an emotionless weapon for the Marines.
keyActions: Unleashes massive Ursus Shock attack on Little Oars Jr.

characterSpotlights.development: Shows his greed and cruelty, viewing Little Oars Jr. as nothing more than a future zombie addition to his collection. Delivers the final blow to the fallen giant.
keyActions: Impales Little Oars Jr. with Tsuno-Tokage
Argues with Doflamingo about damaging his future zombie

characterSpotlights.development: Enters the battle and attacks both sides indiscriminately, maintaining her independent stance and revealing that her true loyalty lies only with Luffy.
keyActions: Attacks both pirates and marines without distinction

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded Little Oars Jr.'s battle against the Giant Squad with additional action sequences not present in the manga.
The flashback of Ace making the kasa for Little Oars Jr. was extended in the anime with more detail about Ace burning the first two attempts.
The anime featured exceptional animation quality for this episode, particularly during Kuma's Ursus Shock and Doflamingo's leg-cutting scene, with less censorship than expected.

trivia.fact: This episode aired on August 29, 2010, and achieved a TV rating of 9.4%, ranking 3rd in its timeslot.
The episode adapts content from Chapter 554 (page 14) and Chapter 555 (pages 2-19) of the One Piece manga.

Fans praised this episode as 'the most action packed and bloodiest episode in a long time' with exceptional animation quality, particularly noting that Doflamingo's brutal leg-cutting scene was shown without heavy censorship.

The kasa (traditional Japanese conical hat) that Ace made for Little Oars Jr. was crafted in Wano Country, one of the earliest references to this important location that would become central to the story much later.

sources.title: Little Oars Jr. - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The episode has an IMDb rating of 9.2/10, making it one of the highest-rated episodes in the Marineford Arc.

sources.title: One Piece - Majin no Shison! Little Oars Jr. Bakushin! - IMDb
